description: Defines a job to ingest data to IoT SiteWise from Amazon S3. For more information, see Create a bulk import job (CLI) in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

parameters.name: jobName
parameters.description: The unique name that helps identify the job request.

parameters.name: jobRoleArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the IAM role that allows IoT SiteWise to read Amazon S3 data.

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: The files in the specified Amazon S3 bucket that contain your data. (dict) --- The file in Amazon S3 where your data is saved. The name of the Amazon S3 bucket from which data is imported. The key of the Amazon S3 object that contains your data. Each object has a key that is a unique identifier. Each object has exactly one key. versionId (string) --- The version ID to identify a specific version of the Amazon S3 object that contains your data.

nested_params.name: bucket
nested_params.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket from which data is imported.

nested_params.name: key
nested_params.description: The key of the Amazon S3 object that contains your data. Each object has a key that is a unique identifier. Each object has exactly one key.

nested_params.name: versionId
nested_params.description: The version ID to identify a specific version of the Amazon S3 object that contains your data.

parameters.name: errorReportLocation
parameters.description: The Amazon S3 destination where errors associated with the job creation request are saved. The name of the Amazon S3 bucket to which errors associated with the bulk import job are sent. Amazon S3 uses the prefix as a folder name to organize data in the bucket. Each Amazon S3 object has a key that is its unique identifier in the bucket. Each object in a bucket has exactly one key. The prefix must end with a forward slash (/). For more information, see Organizing objects using prefixes in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_params.name: bucket
nested_params.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket to which errors associated with the bulk import job are sent.

nested_params.name: prefix
nested_params.description: Amazon S3 uses the prefix as a folder name to organize data in the bucket. Each Amazon S3 object has a key that is its unique identifier in the bucket. Each object in a bucket has exactly one key. The prefix must end with a forward slash (/). For more information, see Organizing objects using prefixes in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

parameters.name: jobConfiguration
parameters.description: Contains the configuration information of a job, such as the file format used to save data in Amazon S3. The file format of the data in S3. csv (dict) --- The file is in .CSV format. The column names specified in the .csv file. (string) --- parquet (dict) --- The file is in parquet format.

nested_params.name: fileFormat
nested_params.description: The file format of the data in S3.

nested_params.name: columnNames
nested_params.description: The column names specified in the .csv file.

nested_params.name: parquet
nested_params.description: The file is in parquet format.

nested_items.name: jobName
nested_items.description: The unique name that helps identify the job request.

nested_items.name: jobStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the bulk import job can be one of following values:
PENDING --- IoT SiteWise is waiting for the current bulk import job to finish.
CANCELLED --- The bulk import job has been canceled.
RUNNING --- IoT SiteWise is processing your request to import your data from Amazon S3.
COMPLETED --- IoT SiteWise successfully completed your request to import data from Amazon S3.
FAILED --- IoT SiteWise couldn't process your request to import data from Amazon S3. You can use logs saved in the specified error report location in Amazon S3 to troubleshoot issues.

COMPLETED_WITH_FAILURES --- IoT SiteWise completed your request to import data from Amazon S3 with errors. You can use logs saved in the specified error report location in Amazon S3 to troubleshoot issues.
